str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
From a compound of peitho and archo; to be persuaded by a ruler, i.e. to submit to authority; by analogy, to conform to advice.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
